IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, ADVOCACY TRAINING AND RELATED SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEMBERS AND LOCAL AFFILIATES IN OREGON.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, ADVOCACY TRAINING AND RELATED SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEMBERS AND LOCAL AFFILIATES IN OREGON.
IRS990.Description: THE CENTER FOR PUBLIC AFFAIRS WORKS TO ADVANCE THE RIGHTS OF SCHOOL EMPLOYEES AND TO PROMOTE LEGISLATIVE ENACTMENTS THAT IMPROVE THE EDUCATIONAL PROCESS FROM PRESCHOOL THROUGH GRADE 14.

Activity2.Description: THE CENTER FOR ADVOCACY AND AFFILIATE SERVICES ADMINISTERS BARGAINING AND MEMBER RIGHTS PROGRAMS. UNIFIED SERVICE STAFF ARE LOCATED AROUND THE STATE TO WORK WITH ASSOCIATION REPRESENTATIVES AT EACH WORK SITE.

Activity3.Description: THE CENTER FOR LEGAL SERVICES PROVIDES FINANCIAL AND CONSULTATIVE RESOURCES TO PROTECT THE LEGAL RIGHTS OF MEMBERS. STAFF ALSO COORDINATE REPRESENTATION AND TRAINING ON EMERGING LEGAL ISSUES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Amt of Rent. Exp Assoc. with Rent. Incom $145094

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XII, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Amt of Rental Exp. Associated With Rent. $145094

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Amounts paid by OEA to organizations are considered unrestricted contributions to the receiving organization's general operating activities and are not generally restricted for a specific purpose other than to support the organization's mission. There is no reporting requirement by the receiving organization to OEA regarding the use of the funds and there is no requirement to perform services or return the funds if restrictions are not met.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Base compensation includes base pay plus auto allowance and companion travel as agreed upon in a signed employment contract.Gail Rasmussen base pay also includes housing allowance.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make its governing documents or financial statements available to the public except as required by federal and state law.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization has a compensation policy that ensures the payment of reasonable compensation to its officers, directors, and key employees -- that is, payment of compensation in an amount that would ordinarily be paid for like services by a like organization under like circumstances.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board has approved the written OEA Officals conflicts-of-interest policy that will be in effect for the next 990 filing.The organization is preparing a written whistleblower policy that the Executive Committee will review and submit to the Board of Directors for adoption. Similar policies have been informal and inprecisely written in the current Board of Directors handbook which is provided to all Board members.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is reviewed before filing by the organization's management and provided to the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors. The final Form 990 is available to the Board of Directors.
